title: v1.3.3: Prysm crashes on startup; illegal instruction

labels.name: Blocked
labels.description: Blocked by research or external factors

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
FreeBSD 122R-test2 12.2-RELEASE-p3 FreeBSD 12.2-RELEASE-p3 amd64
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
1.3.3
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** 
  
# go version
go version go1.16.2 freebsd/amd64
  

  
CPU: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2670 v3 @ 2.30GHz (2300.00-MHz K8-class CPU)
  Origin="GenuineIntel"  Id=0x306f2  Family=0x6  Model=0x3f  Stepping=2
  Features=0x1f83fbff
  Features2=0xfffa3203
  AMD Features=0x2c100800
  AMD Features2=0x21
  Structured Extended Features=0x27ab
  Structured Extended Features3=0xbc000400
  XSAVE Features=0x1
  IA32_ARCH_CAPS=0xc
  TSC: P-state invariant
Hypervisor: Origin = "VMwareVMware"

After doing some spelunking, it looks like the underlying cause is two issues: - herumi/bls-eth-go-binary has a typo in herumi/bls-eth-go-binary/blob/master/bls/bls.go: 
#cgo freebsd,amd64 LDFLAGS:-L${SRCDIR}/lib/linux/amd64
- prysm does not build herumi/bls-eth-go-binary and just brings in their pre-built archives. In this case, the Linux one. I've got an initial version of a FreeBSD port created and will add it to the ports tree after some additional testing. I'll also open a PR for the typo fix for herumi/bls-eth-go-binary. Ignoring the above, so far, it appears as if prysm v1.3.3 runs fine under FreeBSD.
Is this still an issue in recent release?

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have or find the answers we need so that we can investigate further.
